snippet: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission voted 4 to 1 to grant a license to build nuclear reactors, the first such approval since 1978.
abstract: Nuclear Regulatory Commission votes 4 to 1 to grant a license to Southern Company to build and operate two reactors at a nuclear plant in Georgia; it is a crucial threshold for the industry, which has not had a new plant start since 1978; $14 billion project will be closely watched by utilities around the country, many of which are leery of nuclear construction due to huge cost overruns in the 1960s, '70s and '80s.
lead_paragraph: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission voted 4 to 1 to grant a license to build nuclear reactors, the first such approval since 1978.

headline.seo: N.R.C. Approves Building of 2 Reactors in Georgia
headline.main: Federal Regulators Approve Two Nuclear Reactors in Georgia
headline.print_headline: Federal Regulators Approve Two Nuclear Reactors in Georgia
